Senior Product Manager
 
Company Overview
Driven by our vision of the affordable, reliable, net-zero carbon grid of the future, Mainspring has developed a new category of power generation — the linear generator — that delivers onsite, fuel-flexible power to help accelerate the transition to the future grid. 
 
The unique combination of attributes offered by Mainspring’s linear generator enables applications on both the customer and utility sides of the meter for the $750B global electricity equipment market. Mainspring began pilot customer installations in 2020 and plans its full commercial launch in 2021 with Fortune 100 customers and partnerships with top-tier utilities.
 
We are looking to build relationships with people who share our values:
  • Pragmatic Optimism.  Building a new category of world-class power generation requires the optimism of ambition and creativity, balanced with practicality to solve problems efficiently.  The challenges that arise are opportunities for growth.  
  • Excellence without Ego.  We bring expertise and commitment to creating the best customer experience, from sales to deployment and service, just as we apply deep technical rigor to building and delivering world-class products.  We strive for excellence and behave as leaders with the humility to acknowledge our challenges, both collectively and as individual contributors.
  • Proactive Collaboration.  The integration and cross-disciplinary nature of Mainspring’s business requires intentionally seeking out others who bring different skills, perspectives, and priorities.  Our culture of inclusion and respect extends beyond our team to interactions with our partners and customers.
Mainspring is based in Menlo Park and is backed by top-tier venture and strategic investors such as Khosla Ventures, Bill Gates, American Electric Power, and Centrica Innovations.  More information can be found at www.mainspringenergy.com.  
 
Responsibilities                  
At Mainspring, Product Managers sit at the intersection of engineering, sales, marketing, installation, and maintenance to ensure that all of these elements come together to deliver successful products that maximize value for both customers and Mainspring.  Our ideal Senior Product Manager has high horsepower with a technical background and strong communication skills. They enjoy and excel at engaging with customers, engineers, and consultants to fully identify customer needs and to translate them into technical specifications for Mainspring’s teams.  
 
Specific responsibilities for this role:
  • Own all aspects of the product management process from opportunity identification through full product release
  • Identify, define, and quantify market opportunities and requirements by performing market research, customer interviews, economic analysis, and competitor benchmarking
  • Develop product requirement documentation and collaborate with engineering teams to make trade-offs between customer needs, technical capabilities, performance and cost; and create quantitative analysis tools to enable clear visibility into these trade-offs
  • Collaborate with internal Mainspring teams across sales, marketing, installation, and maintenance to develop product documentation and marketing materials
  • Represent Mainspring for sales support and at industry and customer events
Qualifications                      
  • Multiple successful releases of non-consumer hardware products (energy generation or large capital equipment is a plus)
  • Bachelor of Science or higher in engineering or related technical field
  • Experience working with engineering, sales, and installation teams
  • Strong communication skills and an outgoing personality 
  • Excellent analytical reasoning and organization skills with ability to function well in a fast-paced startup environment

Your critical contribution will be rewarded and directly enable Mainspring’s aggressive growth targets.

Responsibilities
Mainspring is growing rapidly and starting to manufacture our Linear Generators.  We are looking for a skilled Commodity Manager in Electrical/Electronics disciplines to help in developing the supply chain to handle the increase in volume and production.  This position will be key in the sourcing and development of qualified and cost-effective suppliers to support our growth. 
 
You have comprehensive knowledge of industrial electrical components (relays, breakers, fuses, transformers, capacitors, resistors, cables & wire harnesses, connectors, sensors, sheet metal chassis, etc),  power electronics components (IGBT switches, DC/DC converters, busbars, thermal management components, batteries and chargers, etc.), printed circuit board and electrical assemblies, and testing processes to integrate those components into finished products.

  • Build and manage effective supplier relationships to source, validate, and manage the supply base for various complex electrical components and assemblies - ultimately to deliver a best total cost supply chain
  • Negotiate pricing and vendor strategy as parts move from through their lifecycle, from fast-turn R&D to long term agreements for volume manufacturing
  • Evaluate processes and procedures and operational requirements while working with the suppliers to improve both quality and price
  • Lead DFM and should-cost analysis projects for cost improvements
  • Travel up to 50%
Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in an engineering (or equivalent) discipline, including Supply Chain
  • Able to travel up to 50%
  • At least 8 years’ experience in a supply chain organization with a proven track record of supplier evaluation, contract negotiation and global supply base management
  • Deep knowledge in several electrical assembly and manufacturing processes, e.g. cutting, stripping, bending, forming, soldering, crimping, fixturing, screwing, riveting, press-fitting, welding, PCB manufacturing (multi-layered), PCBA manufacturing (SMT, through-hole and mix) and design for manufacturing and testing (DFM/DFT)
  • Skilled Excel user with a good understanding of MRP & ERP systems
  • Experience in lean manufacturing and automated assembly processes, with Six Sigma and LEAN Certification a plus

Responsibilities                  
Mainspring is seeking a self-starter Automation Controls Engineer to create and deploy new automation equipment for manufacturing processes.  We are looking for a hands-on contributor, who will be directly involved in transitioning our breakthrough new technology from pilot to volume manufacturing.  Your contributions will be integral to Mainspring achieving its exciting growth targets.
 
You will work closely with various teams at Mainspring including product design, software, manufacturing, test, and field operations, to collect requirements for equipment functionality. You will also interface with external equipment suppliers for project management, conducting design reviews and acceptance tests.
  • Create machine level controls architecture, controls standards and specifications
  • Design detailed electrical, pneumatic and fluid schematics for machine controls
  • Program and debug controls logic for process and test automation equipment
  • Generate user friendly operator interfaces for automation equipment 
  • Design and implement reliable safety control systems for safeguarding motion systems
  • Develop Manufacturing Execution System tracking and traceability database 
  • Manage external machine builders from project kick-off through commissioning
  • Train technicians in operation and maintenance of manufacturing equipment
  • Upgrade manufacturing equipment for part/product design changes and make hardware/software improvements to increase quality and yield
Qualifications:                
  • BS/MS in Electrical, Mechatronic, Controls and Computer Control Systems
  • 2-7 years of experience working on automation and/or electromechanical systems
  • Experience going through at least 1 complete cycle from new manufacturing process equipment development to hand-off to Production and Maintenance
  • Advanced proficiency programming: PLCs (Beckhoff, AB RSLogix), robot and servo motion systems, Field bus Networks, serial communication between PLCs and tooling
  • Database programming, web based dashboards data visualization and API communication between different systems. Bonus for MySQL, XML, VBA
  • Capable to learn quickly logic programming such as QuickBase function block, C++, CMake, Linux, Python and cloud programming (AWS or GCP)
